website_summaries.verdict: Sporting 21 awesome games, including the all-new Star Fox 2, and a pair of controllers, this retro console is ready for multiplayer fun right out of the box. Play it loud!
pros: 21 awesome Super NES games, including Donkey Kong Country, Super Mario Kart, and EarthBound
cons: Has fewer games than most other consoles, but these games are the best

website_summaries.verdict: Donkey Kong Country made shockwaves in 1994, and between its challenge, graphics, and charm, this mini-console is the ultimate introduction to the SNES classic.
pros: Includes Donkey Kong Country, 20 other games, and pair of controllers
DKC sports co-op and competitive modes
cons: Donkey Kong Country may be tough for newcomers

website_summaries.verdict: Easily the greatest way to enjoy the best Kirby games of the 90s, alongside the golf-like Dream Course and variety of high-action adventures in Super Star.
pros: Includes Kirby’s Dream Course and Kirby Super Star, which sports 8 games by itself!
Features 19 other superb Super Nintendo games
cons: The most expensive Kirby game bundle available

website_summaries.verdict: The SNES Classic is a nearly perfect retro console that’s a slam-dunk recommendation for everyone.
pros: The SNES Classic Edition provides a pixel-perfect Super Nintendo experience by packing in 21 games and two authentic SNES gamepads with longer cords
Games can be paused, rewound and saved
cons: There's no way to back out into the game selection menu without hitting the reset button

customer_reviews.title: If you never want to see your husband or kids again, go for it!
customer_reviews.text: Warning: product may entertain husband and children for hours, leaving you with previously unprecedented time to yourself. If you’re considering going back to school, starting a business, or just need some peace and quiet (in every room but the one where this is set up), this is the perfect product to make sure you will not be bothered in your endeavors or lack thereof. Negative side effects may include but are not limited to: your adult-ish husband pacing by the door and checking your amazon incessantly for days in anticipation of the console’s arrival, said adult giggling like a child upon product delivery, and hysterical whining by children and adults alike when you finally pull the power cord.
customer_reviews.author: Hudgens Family

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love this little system! So much fun in with two players or one. No problems with mine and it is a real Nintendo product.
customer_reviews.author: AZ13

customer_reviews.title: I hate this thing because it's going to sucker me into playing FFVI again. Buy it for your enemies. Five Stars.
customer_reviews.text: It took me a while to figure out how the suspend points (basically a new way of saving your current game state APART from whatever save game system the original cartridge would have had, extremely useful as an adult who may have to go and take a phone call instead of waiting for an in-game save point) work. It seems like you actually get four of them PER GAME, not four total, which is extremely useful. Also, it runs off of USB power. So I've got the whole rig running out of the controller port on my PS3, thus creating the Human Centipede of Game Consoles.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Easton

customer_reviews.title: Only 21 games, no expandability without hacking and pirating
customer_reviews.text: SNES is my favorite game platform, but this product falls short as it comes out of the box. There are only 21 games, and while there are a lot of good games here (including rare ones like Earthbound and the unreleased StarFox 2), it's missing a LOT of important games like Donkey Kong Country 2 (this omission boggles my brain), Pilotwings, Super Bomberman 3, Chrono Trigger, and Super Mario All-Stars. You're better off just buying a clone system that does HDMI and used games if you don't want to pirate (this is what I actually ended up doing). It's a fun thing to have in my collection, but it would have been a lot more useful if it took cartridges.
customer_reviews.author: Danny B

customer_reviews.title: My kids love this gaming system
customer_reviews.text: My kids love this gaming system. They are 6 and 2 years of age. My two year old can do very little on it and doesn't understand the point but he gets excited and has fun pushing the buttons. My six year old girl is enjoying it a lot and can play for hours. I feel like these game systems are much better for hand and eye coordination than a tablet ever will be. It came in the right box and is the right gaming system. I would definitely recommend this system to my friends with kids.
customer_reviews.author: SnakeB

customer_reviews.title: Controller stopped working after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my sons birthday and the controller stopped working after 2 months of play. Seriously? My mother in law still has her original Nintendo and the controllers still work on her OLD game but this brand new replica fails to work after 2 months?
customer_reviews.author: SRJ

customer_reviews.title: Knock off imitation. NOT what is pictured. Includes no games.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered for my son's birthday. It is not the real thing, it's a cheap knock off and you have to purchase the games separately. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa M. Casina

customer_reviews.title: Great throwback console done right (mostly)
customer_reviews.text: Great little system with some great classic titles that play the same as they originally did, with some modern conveniences like the ability to rewind a game about 40 seconds to retry something you messed up/missed and save states for all the games. The interface is mostly intuitive but no way to go back to the menu without hitting the reset on the actual console box. The contollers feel like the classic versions, the cords are longer than the NES classic, still not as long as a real one, but I didn't have problems with the length while playing. Great that these are in continuing production so getting them for MSRP is something that can be done given some patience.
customer_reviews.author: Magik8Baul

customer_reviews.title: No Super Mario Bros
customer_reviews.text: Maybe it's been too long, and I couldn't remember all the different names. I thought I was getting Super Mario Bros.. Nope - just Mario World or something. Totally sucks. You need to get the NES Classic Edition, not the Super NES Classic - hahahaha.. great naming... Donkey Kong is super pixelated and cords are short - you have to buy the extensions. In short - was excited to get this and turns out to suck. Can't return as I'm overseas.
customer_reviews.author: Rice

customer_reviews.title: Ok, probably not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Controller cords are laughably short. It is almost like Nintendo did it as a joke. Buy extenders as soon as you buy the system. The game select screen music is super annoying and doesn’t come off as something Nintendo came up with. For some reason the jump button only works 95% of the time. Similar to the Switch NES games. Absolutely infuriating. Not sure if that is just how older games were or something Nintendo did. Would have paid twice as much to get the games ported to widescreen instead of 4:3 with crappy filler on the sides.
customer_reviews.author: brandonjlacy

customer_reviews.title: Nostalgia!
customer_reviews.text: Was a BIG fan of the original SNES back in the day. Was excited to get my hands on the SNES Classic. It’s mini. It’s cool. Includes most of the games I used to play. Introduced my son to the video games I used to play as a kid. Includes 2 controllers, unlike the NES classic. (even though they are both awesome.) The controller cords are short. Bought myself some extenders to complete the purchase. Now, if you need me, I’ll be off playing Super Mario World and swearing at the tv.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Odell

customer_reviews.title: Overheats Easily
customer_reviews.text: I love the games on here, and have a blast playing them. My only complaint is that the unit gets really hot pretty quickly and then it takes about 30 minutes to cool down. If you want to change the game you're playing, then you have to turn the unit off, let it cool down and then try again half an hour later, and possibly it will start. I am happy with the gameplay, nostalgia factor is huge here, but disappointed with the product as a whole.
customer_reviews.author: Derek Starr

customer_reviews.title: Great console but dont pay over 100 for it.
customer_reviews.text: Was able to get it during the Amazon flash sale on it for $80. I absolutely love it. The games that come with it by default are great and if you feel that something is missing you can very easily mod the console to add more games and everything will work perfectly fine. The only complaint I really have is as stated by many others, the controller cable length is pretty short (about 4.5 feet) so unless you by an extension for it you'll have to sit somewhat close to your tv.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Luna

customer_reviews.title: For bad parents, this will save your kid from boredom over the summer
customer_reviews.text: This has been such a hit. We have these long gaps between summer activities and I work from home a lot so my kid was driving me crazy! (Yeah, bad parent alert, I let my kids play video games instead of planning outings and stuff to fill every second of their summer schedule). It's so much easier to use than the original SNES and with the games preloaded my kid can discover something new to play. We even used it in our car while driving back from California, it uses a USB plug for power so it doesn't take much to run it. Very happy with this purchase...
customer_reviews.author: Andrew P. Funk

customer_reviews.title: Finally the wait paid off
customer_reviews.text: So I missed the first round of SNES but but it in my wishlist and got a notice of deal Friday.It arrived today in all its glory,love the controllers feels exactly like the original.You will need a much longer HDMI cable,I used a 9 foot one which is perfect to get a decent distance from a 46 inch TV.Nice mix of games,I waiting for this Friday to get the classic also.Well made product definitely work the money.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Von Maryland

customer_reviews.title: Retro Gaming At It's Finest!
customer_reviews.text: As a kid growing up in the 90's I played alot of super Nintendo as well as Sega Genesis. So when I heard about this I figured I'd get it. Overall a great collection here, all 21 games included are good. Sure there are games that should have been included that weren't, but as with any best of collection that is usually the case. The only downside about the snes classic for me is the short controller cords, so getting the extensions is a must. I enjoyed this so much that I actually bought a second one later on. If you're into retro gaming I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Steyata

customer_reviews.title: OMG. SO AWESOME.
customer_reviews.text: This is the greatest $80 I ever spent. Easy to hook up with HDMI cables. Donkey Kong Country on a 65” tv is the most fun you can have with your pants on (not that you need to wear pants.. just sayin). High quality build and controllers work perfect. I’ve had knockoff sega systems that are fun-ish but are basically junk. This seems like the real deal. I’m like a kid in a candy store. Now for the classic edition
customer_reviews.author: Mac

customer_reviews.title: Great package even if the cords are super short
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product as long as you don't get ripped off I suppose. I had to buy one (read: find one) after getting one for my brother's birthday. There will always be arguments over the game selection and yes there are fewer games here than in the NES classic. However I'd say all but 2 games are classics from the system. And yes I wish Chrono Trigger was on here along with other stuff but it's truly an amazing package. I do wish the cord was longer. Itll be almost a requirement to buy a wireless controller for this as the cord is very constricting just like the NES classic was as well.
customer_reviews.author: iamtehg

customer_reviews.title: Too expensive, but still worth it
customer_reviews.text: There are a lot of games on here that I have heard are amazing and never played. The system is basically an emulator for these games, and its presentation is very very cool. If you already have most of these games then it probably ain't worth it, but if you're like me and haven't ever seen them before, you're in for a real treat. I was disappointed, however, that Chrono Trigger is not part of the library.
customer_reviews.author: Liam Wofford

customer_reviews.title: It’s the ‘Real Deal’!!!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this used from the Amazon Warehouse. It stated it was in “Acceptable” condition. There is a small mark on one remote and the unit, but it’s barely noticeable and I have children, so it’s not a concern. It came with the two games I desperately wanted, Super Mario Brothers and Zelda, along with several others I like. It did not come with an HDMI cable, but I had one, it wasn’t in the original box or come with the manual, but let’s be real, we don’t keep those anyways, and it was more than $100 less than a new one. All-in-all, I’m super pleased and can’t wait to play this with my 11-year-old daughter!!! Thank you Amazon!!!!
customer_reviews.author: CryMad

customer_reviews.title: Don't overpay. MSRP is the sweet spot
customer_reviews.text: Don't pay more than MSRP for this sweet sweet bundle of fun. Once the nostalgia wears off for nostalgic non-gamers and game connoisseur, they'll regret paying more than 80 USD. If you had to chose between this and classic NES and classic SNES, go with SNES. I'd be embarrassed to tell people I paid more than retail for either of these systems to be had. It'll be an expensive coffee table discussion piece and the games look horrid on today's ginormous HDTV screens. You have been warned, but it's still a hot mess of 16 bit fun at the end of the day.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Authentic Retro Console, better than the last!
customer_reviews.text: I loved the NES Classic, but it had flaws; short controller cords, some questionable choice of games, etc. The SNES Classic takes the retro-console authenticity to another level. The controllers are long enough you don't need to buy extensions, all the games are classic AND, we get the unreleased Star Fox 2 as a bonus! My favorite little touch is that the demo replays it shows on the menu are the last minute or so of YOUR gameplay (if you created a save state it shows your gameplay about 30 seconds before you stopped playing). Hope Nintendo makes an N64 Classic along these same lines!
customer_reviews.author: Cory K. Crawford

customer_reviews.title: No audio and no refund
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for my wife for our anniversary. I use it only 2 times and the audio stopped working. Follow the instructions online by Nintendo to solve the problem without success. To make the situation more difficult. I return the unit to Amazon and they still do not return my money. Very bad experience I do not buy a Nintendo product again. And Amazon has been very negligent with my situation.
customer_reviews.author: Hector J Espinosa

customer_reviews.title: Incredible nostalgia trip
customer_reviews.text: With the NES Classic and SNES Classic, Nintendo found a way to make a ton of money on nostalgia. They put together a collection of classic games and stuffed them into an official product (no more werid clones) in a compact-sized form factor. Unlike the NES Classic, which only came with one controller, this one comes with two, which is great for multi-player. I think the only complaint I have with it is the awkwardness of the save system. You can save up to (I believe) three "snapshots" per game, but a lot of games come with built-in save features, so in some ways, it's a bit redundant.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Ward

customer_reviews.title: Really enjoy it!
customer_reviews.text: I was leery because there are other consoles listed and the reviews were questionable. But I can say that these are the exact games by SNES and they are a lot of fun. I really enjoy Mario Cart and Super Metroid. It's like going back in time but it's also great because these games are just so much fun on their own. The controls are real as well. The only downside is that to my knowledge you can't add new games because these are pre-loaded. But the advantage to them being pre-loaded is that you don't have to keep up with them.
customer_reviews.author: GolferMan

customer_reviews.title: Great console with all the classic SNES games predownloaded
customer_reviews.text: Love this updated console with all the retro favorites already downloaded! Have been alternating between this and my Xbox One X, while I wait for the Switch to be back in stock, and really enjoying playing Super Mario World again. Would definitely recommend for some nostalgic gaming! It also comes with 2 controllers and the console itself is very small , but mighty!
customer_reviews.author: electrocat

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: The graphics are fine for anyone not used to xbox or other game system. No directions for using the controllers made it hard for the kids to navigate the screen and/or choose games to play. Although they made an effort, they quit after about 1/2 hour and had no interest in returning to this NES.
customer_reviews.author: e callie

customer_reviews.title: Retro mega Cool
customer_reviews.text: Wow, what a throw back to my gaming days from the mid 80's. This little thing is Awesome! I sideloaded it with Hackchi and installed about 50 extra game roms. This is a great deal at $79.95 but hard to find for that price. I was lucky I got mine for that from Amazon when they had them. If you love the old gaming or just want to bring back memories or try to beat that game you couldn't then get this and have fun. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: RiceMan

customer_reviews.title: The fact that it comes pre loaded with the 20 games is awesome. The only thing I would change is the ...
customer_reviews.text: I was thrilled to find this new version of the Nentendo that I had growing up! The fact that it comes pre loaded with the 20 games is awesome. The only thing I would change is the length of the controller cords. But I had read the reviews before I bought it and knew this was the case. Either way, it is super fun to play this with my daughter.
customer_reviews.author: Andream

customer_reviews.title: Such a fun blast from the past!
customer_reviews.text: This is such a fun blast from the past! I debated between waiting for the backorder for this and just ordering the other Ninendo which was readily available and am glad I waited! These are the games I grew up with as a kid. I’ve been playing Donkey Kong the most, but my boyfriend and I have played a few rounds of Mario Kart, too. So fun for all ages and much less complicated and expensive than more modern gaming systems! I also have a Sega Genesis with wireless controllers, but like that this Nintendo comes with wired controllers because you don’t have to worry about the signal cutting out and it adds to the classic experience.
customer_reviews.author: Ian H.

customer_reviews.title: A Small piece of Nostalgia!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great throw back to the original game system,( which I used to have), just in a smaller size. The controller is still the same size, but the good thing about the console being smaller is that you can easily find a spot for it. You will want to purchase one of the recommended controller extension cables, so you will not have to sit right up on it, when playing. It still has that old school Nintendo look, without any fuzziness. It brings back so many great memories!
customer_reviews.author: tallgal

customer_reviews.title: Issue with powering up resolved.
customer_reviews.text: After about a year of very infrequent use, it doesn't power on anymore. Sometimes we can fiddle with the buttons and get it to work but it is very touchy, maybe has a bad connection inside. Update: I swapped out the mini USB power cord and it has a better connection now and works normally.
customer_reviews.author: Beemar

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME throwback to classic gaming!
customer_reviews.text: This system is a FANTASTIC throwback to your childhood system. The graphics are good, selection of games is good, and the controllers(most important part in my opinion) are PERFECT. MUCH better than the aftermarket ones you buy to plug into your computer. The only negative thing about this product is that the controller cables (although longer than the NES Classic) are STILL rather short. Maybe I've just gotten spoiled by the modern wireless ones, but I bought two extension cables so that my son and I can play it from the couch rather than sitting on the floor. Other than that, GREAT PRODUCT!!!
customer_reviews.author: Adam Harrison

customer_reviews.title: All around amazing
customer_reviews.text: What a fantastic deal! After being unable to find a snes classic ANYWHERE locally, the seller, "Your Local Dealer" was selling one through Amazon. The shipping was quick and the price absolutely unbeatable. The system looks brand new (though listed as used) and everything works great. The SNES classic is an amazing bundle of nostalgia and worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: D.E.C.

customer_reviews.title: WONKY
customer_reviews.text: Mine had some QC issues with it. I noticed at first METROID the gun aim was totally screwed up, no amount of resetting would fix it. Then on Contra, only one of the players would move. he woudl move if you jumped, but not using the stick. i think I got a bad unit or a set of bad controllers...
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Great Classic games. Cheaply built product.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my SO for his birthday. He's Been wanting one for awhile. While it is entertaining the quality of the actual NES box is very cheap especially what your paying for it. The controllers aren't bad but I ended up buying some wireless ones for him anyways. In short, this has some awesome games with it that him and I enjoy. I'm disappointed in the quality more than anything considering I paid $95+ for it.
customer_reviews.author: Amelia

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!!!
customer_reviews.text: Super fun and nostalgic for 80's born kids. I had to buy this after having so much fun with the NES Classic. I paid just above $100 for this in March of 2019. I hope they make more of these available so they can be had for $70, but it was worth spending the extra $30 for me. Super fun retro gaming system. I would love a Nintendo 64 Classic too! I still have a working Game Cube and Playstation 2 that can also play Playstation 1 games. Now I can play almost any game and game system ever created. It's very fun!!
customer_reviews.author: B. Good

customer_reviews.title: Graphics suck
customer_reviews.text: This was a great game system back in the days but they did not do it justice when they tried to bring it back to life. The graphics really suck. The bigger the TV the worse the pixels get. If NES was not going to make the graphics better for today's technologies then they should of just left it alone and not brought it back to life.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: SNES Classic box was water damaged, product came with saved game info
customer_reviews.text: It arrived late and the packaging was water-damaged. The box is going to dry off but it’s obvious that it got warped by moisture. The console turns on and works well. But it had saved data on some games, which means I’m gonna have to go to each game and see if there’s anything saved there.
customer_reviews.author: OALM

customer_reviews.title: Amazing memories, short controller cords
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely love our SNES Classic - so many good memories. The games look amazing on my tv, which I didn’t expect. The console has most of the classics, but we miss Pilot Wings, Paper Boy, and a few other games we wish were included. One drawback to note - if you have a large tv (ours is 70”), it’s hard to get to a comfortable viewing distance. The controller cords are short which means you can’t get far enough back. I would recommend you attach this to a smaller TV if possible.
customer_reviews.author: Rahul V.

customer_reviews.title: Exact games and unit just miniature size! Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: It is exactly what I was praying for!! My mom has cancer and we spent many nights playing this and my boys playing this! When she got sick she tried everything to get this old one working so I found this in awesome amazon and hoped it had all her favorite games and it did!! Her face was so excited when she opened it and she loves playing again!!! It’s the exact same unit, exact games, just no games all over the room, they are all ready in the unit. And so easy to find and work ♥️
customer_reviews.author: ESORSDOG

customer_reviews.title: I was fearful that I was going to end up with a knock off or get ripped off but I got a genuine brand new SNES Classic and couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased and System works perfectly. All the games and functions work as intended. Was very surprised to see they also had a save option so you can save your progress on game. I was fearful that I was going to end up with a knock off or get ripped off but I got a genuine brand new SNES Classic and couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Courwes

customer_reviews.title: Excellent titles in a small form factor
customer_reviews.text: To best explain just how cool this little machine is, please consider I still own a fully functional Super Nintendo. That machine was great for its day and I still utilize it from time to time for games this machine does not come with. However, this machine has an HDMI port and does not require I test the life of my cartridges I do own. I don't regret this purchase at all even if it's just the amount of space I've saved at my gaming station. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Bowser

customer_reviews.title: Great for passing time
customer_reviews.text: I used to spent my summers back in the 90's playing this. It brought back good memories. Now, the console size is very small but the controls are the same size. It has a couple of good games but I always play the same ones. One thing that I don't like is that there is no way to go back to the main menu without resetting the console. You can go to the game menu but you can't go to the SNES main menu unless you reset.
customer_reviews.author: Omar Rivera

customer_reviews.title: this was a perfect throwback to nostalgia
customer_reviews.text: For me, this was a perfect throwback to nostalgia. I've had a total blast replaying some of my classic favorite titles with friends. It was pretty simple to mod too, so I could add more games to the library. It's compact design is perfect for an entertainment center too! The suspend feature is really cool too, so you can pick up your game instantly where you left off. The only drawback for me is that I wish the controller cables were a little longer. Thankfully, my couch is close to the TV, so it's not as much of an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathon

customer_reviews.title: Amazing opportunity to relive your childhood
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS PRODUCT. I grew up with an SNES and recently had been craving to play some of the games but buying a SNES and all the good games can be add up to be quite the sum of money. This product is an amazing opportunity to relive your childhood playing some of the best games the super nintendo had to offer. Just note that the cords are a bit short!
customer_reviews.author: Katie P

customer_reviews.title: Gaming Excellence
customer_reviews.text: Be prepared to be transported back in time! The games available for the SNES are just as playable and entertaining today as they were 2+ decades ago. I am hooked. Growing up, my friends had Super Nintendos but I did not. I enjoyed playing the games they had but never got to really engage in them fully... Until now! Legend of Zelda and Super Metroid are masterpieces, providing hours of brain-stimulating entertainment.
customer_reviews.author: Brian W

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Good system with everything needed in the box and ready to go. Nintendo clearly made an effort to put this thing together and select good games to go along with it. The menu functionality is good with several adjustable display settings as well as some welcome emulator features you get on a PC such as state saves. Runs on a micro usb cord and any 1 amp or greater usb power supply. Too bad they didnt use USB-C but otherwise no complaints
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin H. Mossberg

customer_reviews.title: Loads of nostalgic fun
customer_reviews.text: I got one of these last December, and it has been untold hour of entertainment. It comes with some timeless classic games that I absolutely loved, and a couple that I never got a chance to play back in the day. My only complaint (which is minor) is that the controller cords are comically short - but that can easily be solved with either extension cords, or aftermarket wireless controllers. Overall, I am VERY glad I picked one of these up.
customer_reviews.author: Wes D

customer_reviews.title: The game selection is great and the old school controllers feel just like the ...
customer_reviews.text: Nostalgia seeping out of every port. The game selection is great and the old school controllers feel just like the original. Loses one star for not having a marketplace to get more games and not having a MicroSD port to accommodate them. You'd think that would be a no-brainer. Leaving enthusiasts to break the system open rather than allow legal purchases seems like leaving money on the table to me.
customer_reviews.author: C. Wade

customer_reviews.title: Amazing.
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have for fans of the SNES console. Especially with some 3rd party software, you will have a dedicated 'console' for your SNES ROM collection. Wonderful build quality and the controllers feel just like the originals. Well worth the wait, I would NOT recommend spending more than retail for this item however. I could justify $79.99 but anything more is just wasting money in my opinion. So if you can hold out to find one in stock selling at MSRP grab it for sure, but if all you can find is a scalped unit above MSRP don't bother.
customer_reviews.author: Richard H.

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I have kids. And while I grew up with gaming. I do not like what gaming has evolved into. So I picked up a NES and SNES classic for my youngest kids. They fell in love with them both. If you have kids and they have not experienced modern gaming, let them have one of these first. You can always get a modern console latter down the road.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Blast from the Past!
customer_reviews.text: Oh my goodness, my husband and I have had hours of fun playing the old Nintendo Zelda and Metroid games. We played them when they first came out many, many years ago when there weren't any walkthroughs available online but this time we definitely used them but it was still just so much fun. So easy to hook up to our tv, even we old folks did it.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: feel like a kid again!
customer_reviews.text: omg! the fact that this is for sale is amazing i didnt even know they made this anymore....i feel like a child again...however it is not the old school one, its like a miniature version and it comes with the games integrated into the system, there is no slot to insert games purchased separate. but this is not a big deal because the game i played is on of the ones preinstalled
customer_reviews.author: Juju221

customer_reviews.title: Good buy. Several classics make it worth the money. Multiplayer is cool. Memberberries.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good. Missed some classics, and Starfox is absolute trash until N64. Couple real throwaway/neverplays in there. Zelda and Mario World made it worth the money alone though, all the kirbys and mega man, Metroid, Mario Kart, Donkey Kong, those are all awesome. It can be made much cheaper than what they’re selling it for tho but I’m still glad they did.
customer_reviews.author: Chip

customer_reviews.title: Great product - beware of abusive pricing and lack of peripherals
customer_reviews.text: Does not include the adapter to plug in to a standard wall plug. You can power the console via mUSB-USB only, so hopefully you have an extra USB-plug adapter (like you use for your phone, identical to Android). This along with the significantly increased price from Nintendo's original release made the purchase somewhat disappointing, despite loving everything about the console after I found a way to plug it in and turn it on.
customer_reviews.author: Calamos

customer_reviews.title: Worth the 4 month wait, but don't feed the scalpers
customer_reviews.text: Great system, especially for list price. Unfortunately, I don't have the time to spend on these (sometimes very challenging) games as I'd like. The only relatively minor problems I have are: 1) Very short cords make it necessary to but extensions 2) You have to get up to manually reset when changing games 3) Slight controller delay makes some platform games even more difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Piter

customer_reviews.title: My 10-year-old loves it
customer_reviews.text: My oldest has been into all the new games, having almost no exposure to the "retro" games of my past. I bought this for both of my kids, actually thinking my 6-year-old my enjoy it more. My 10-year-old will set it up himself and play for an hour. It's very easy to plug and play. It has a nice selection of games. It is also much smaller than I expected. Smaller than my hand and I have tiny hands.
customer_reviews.author: S. Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Great Classic gaming console
customer_reviews.text: I was so happy to hear Nintendo came out with a modern Super Nintendo console that could be used with HDMI and the best part of this new console is no more game cartridges that you have to blow in in order to get them to work. Today’s kids will never know that struggle LOL. I hate to admit I was one of the ones that paid above retail to get one but I’m glad I did. I am able to relive my childhood of playing donky Kong country
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Hours and Hours of Fun.
customer_reviews.text: F-Zero and Super Mario Brother just like it always was. Better than original because you can save your spot, and rewind your game if you die. Unbelievable. My kids love playing with me.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Patterson

customer_reviews.title: check your merchandise
customer_reviews.text: Well yeah, its the console as advertised by Nintendo original and all, BUT. i didn't get the american version i got the superfamicon version wich is pretty much the same. just different body no complains over here, about the console, only that it would be nice to have the one been advertised not the overseas version.
customer_reviews.author: carlos.

customer_reviews.title: Twenty one SNES games
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived early and in perfect NEW condition. The SNES is kind of hard to find new, and if you do find one it’s going to cost you more than the 79.99 MRSP. With that being said it’s still a good deal for 21 SNES games, save capabilities, and modern USB hookups. I paid 120 dollars and still feel grateful to have the SNES Classic. Merry Christmas to me.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this!
customer_reviews.text: Would love to give this no stars if possible. Not the Classic NES system. This is a knock off, a very cheap knock off!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best retro multi game console yet
customer_reviews.text: Best retro mini console of all. Wish Sega would do this for Genesis. Really good looking and quality. Fun presentation. Good game selection. So many more awesome SNES games could be included. Feels and sounds and looks right. Nice options and save states make a big difference. Two great controllers with longer cables. Good value.
customer_reviews.author: Chris E. Reilly

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I loved the Snes Mini for a few reasons. Paramount of them all however is the fact that you are able to play the Super Nintendos biggest hits. But you also get 2 controllers with the same connector at the Wii and Wiiu giving some more versitility to the purchase. Add to that the modding Community has made this system even better allowing for other emulators and games to be played on it.
customer_reviews.author: Stewie

customer_reviews.title: Childhood Nostalgia
customer_reviews.text: I always have to start my review with the condition of the box and item. The system box arrived in great condition, perfect for unveiling videos and let’s me know it was handled with care. The system itself is a gem! The compact size is beneficial to be packed away in travel case (purchased separately) . I’ve played Zelda and Super Mario for hours on it so far and only downfall is the short cords. Mostly due to having my tv mounted, it makes the short cords seem shorter. I highly suggest the purchase, and I love that amazon was one of the legitimized carriers for this system. GameStop always seemed to never have in stock.
customer_reviews.author: Kylie Senikaucava

customer_reviews.title: Fun Times
customer_reviews.text: A return to the past with this preloaded SNES console. I recommend buying controller extensions and they are a bit short. The console is preloaded with 20 games, without the ability to play the original cartridges. It uses a HDMI cable and is great for playing some of the best games from my childhood.
customer_reviews.author: DM Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Awesome.  Nostalgic.
customer_reviews.text: This product works well and brought back a lot of nostalgia. Being in my 30's, I don't sit down and play it like I used to, but my wife and I have fun with the 2 player games. Functions well and saves as you go, so a big improvement on the original. I would highly recommend getting Bluetooth remotes. I purchased the 8Bitdo SN30 2.4G Wireless Controller and have been very satisfied with the little time I have had to play this.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Chastain

customer_reviews.title: Broke :(
customer_reviews.text: We bought this in May of 2018 and now (April of 2019) it randomly turns off about every 15 minutes. All game data is erased. We only play with this thing 3-4 times a month at the most and take very good care of it so it's very disappointing that it didn't even last a full year for us. I will reach out to their customer support once I figure out how to.
customer_reviews.author: Topher

customer_reviews.title: Technical Error !
customer_reviews.text: i bought all mini consoles ( PS1 , SEGA, NINTENDO, FAMICOM ) they all work perfectly, but this SNES Classic doesn't work smoothly, when i play and i try to press RESET button, suddenly the device SHUTDOWN, then i try to turn it on, but No Power ? i have to try many times to turn it on but No Power, after my 8th attempt it will work, but i will face the same problem again ?
customer_reviews.author: Ahmed Al-Dheeb

customer_reviews.title: Great System.  Nintendo Needs to add more games
customer_reviews.text: Great system. Reminds me of my childhood. I hope Nintendo comes out with an official mod so more games can be added. Currently there are ways to modify the system but the quality of game are not guaranteed and you could brick the system. I am cool with the 20 games it has know but I am hopeful Nintendo will come out with official Mod Packs with more games. Also the 8bitdo wireless controllers are a must.
customer_reviews.author: David W

customer_reviews.title: Wrong Item
customer_reviews.text: I received the wrong item. I got a NES classic Not the Super NES classic. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: H. Walsh

customer_reviews.title: This was a gift to my grandson.  He absolutely loves it!
customer_reviews.text: This Super NES Classic is the best, and the best price through AMAZON. My grandson just loves it, and it is helping to keep him busy, and happy, because there are so many preloaded games. This is definitely helping us to get through this pandemic. Great investment.
customer_reviews.author: C. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Great product for video game lovers
customer_reviews.text: Great system! Love that the games are preloaded. We keep this in the car as an option for the kids to keep entertained while we drive. My husband and I used to play these games and it tickles me that my kids like then too. Buy the Amazon case for this system. It fits perfectly
customer_reviews.author: Dezarey

customer_reviews.title: needs longer cords, other than that it is a good source of entertainment
customer_reviews.text: the only issue i have with the system is the cords are too short, especially the controllers. would be much better with longer cords as we sit farther from the tv now than back in the day since our tvs are so much larger now. the games have gotten harder or i am just that much worse now (which is probably the case), but i am enjoying the system.
customer_reviews.author: B. Wong

customer_reviews.title: Tons of classics
customer_reviews.text: So I love it because I didn’t have a Super Nintendo growing up however I did play it at friends houses for hours. This gave me a trip down memory lane
customer_reviews.author: edward white

customer_reviews.title: Better options
customer_reviews.text: Go on eBay, people have options with the same platform and they add thousands of extra games for a bit more in price.
customer_reviews.author: Lakegeorge12845

customer_reviews.title: which anyone would love. While the item was new
customer_reviews.text: The item arrived at the earliest date expected, which anyone would love. While the item was new, it appeared that it had been opened before, as there was no adhesive at the box opening as there would be normally. Small complaint. The system itself works great, and my children are already having a great time with it! I would do business with this seller again, and I would HIGHLY recommend this way cool (and even smaller than expected) blast from the past!
customer_reviews.author: thugninjah

customer_reviews.title: YES!
customer_reviews.text: Not a huge Nintendo fan boy/girl, but we grew up with these games and the kids love them. It's fun to watch them play the same games (and more!) that we played in our youth. The title selection is pretty good. A good chunk of the classics are there - Zelda, Mario, etc. Some titles are less than stellar hits, but it's more than made up for with AAA titles from the Super Nintendo era. Get them before they're all gone!!
customer_reviews.author: E. Ronakov

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working in less than 12 months.
customer_reviews.text: I really loved playing the games when I first got the item, but after 11 months I’m unable to play anything. About 2 months ago I found that any time I plugged in and tried to play anything the system would shut down. After messing with cables I’m attempting a fix with a wireless controller but not much hope.
customer_reviews.author: Nipper

customer_reviews.title: Relive Nintendo's golden era... if you can find one.
customer_reviews.text: Cute toy, the emulation is very good, hooks up with HDMI, is incredibly small and light, so you can be flexible with where you place it. Controllers will almost certainly need extensions, however, and it's a real shame it didn't come with Chrono Trigger. Still, for what it is, it's not a bad way to relive some of that 16 bit nostalgia.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca L. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift, and Great Memories to go along with it.
customer_reviews.text: My Fathers SNES broke recently and he was pretty bummed of the situation which we can all sympathize to some degree. It's been apart of hour family for years and years and it's even older than I. So I decided that the Super NES Classic would be a great Fathers Day gift and it certainly put a smile on his face. Only complaint was that he can't put Super Bases Loaded onto the device since there is no slot to insert a cartridge in the console. But that's only one game he won't be able to play all the while every other game we have is installed in this system and even more.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING
customer_reviews.text: This is a lot smaller than I anticipated it to be, but I didnt read the. dimensions. I had to get extension cables for the remotes because they are very short. and to change games you have to get up and hit the reset button. but other than that, its amazing. My boyfriend loved it for our anniversary
customer_reviews.author: rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Perfect. Does as it says on the tin with ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. Does as it says on the tin with no messing about. The only downside is that you must press the physical reset button to use save states or change games. There is a way to get around this with wireless controllers, I receive them on Wednesday. Those let you down select and down. There may be another hack to do it with the wired.. unknown.
customer_reviews.author: db

customer_reviews.title: Family Entertainment
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my granddaughters 7th birthday. I got it the day before. Fast shipping considering I ordered it 2 days previous. She was wild about it. Though she has only played 2 games on it , her dadand all his friends (major gamers) come over everynight (after she is asleep) and play it. They think the graphics are sic. Hope I am spelling that right . The machine is perfect they say everything is great. They are having a great time strolling down Memory Lane. I guess I picked the the right item for the whole family.
customer_reviews.author: Candice Dodge

customer_reviews.title: Best Way to Experience the 16-Bit Era
customer_reviews.text: This remastered console gave me a glimpse of the past I never got to have. I really enjoy the attention of detail that Nintendo put into the minimization of this console. The collection of games have some familiar to me and some that aren’t quite familiar. Almost all of them are enjoyable to play solo or with a friend when a title allows it. This console has been the only thing I have been playing for about a month now. Definitely a wise investment if you like to play simple, but very fun games.
customer_reviews.author: Noah Abrigo

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic value and gift for gamers
customer_reviews.text: Love this... I have an SNES but wanted the Earthbound game, which apparently sells for hundreds of dollars. Instead of spending all that money, I'm able to play Earthbound, plus a bunch of other games. Only downside is that I wish it had Tetris Attack! Plus it would be nice if they had option for wireless remotes. The nostalgia of accidentally plugging out your controller is something I don't miss.
customer_reviews.author: melissae

customer_reviews.title: Great console with plenty of built-in games
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this console. It had plenty of games and some I have never played before. The save states are nice. The interface is clean. The controllers are authentic and work great. If there is one complaint it's that the controller cords are short.
customer_reviews.author: maninblue

customer_reviews.title: The Classic Games, Just Like You Remember
customer_reviews.text: It can take a little getting used to, seeing the older, grainy graphics on newer televisions, but everything about these games is just like you remember, the controllers feel the same, and it provides an easy way to play things on the old platform. Much easier than using an original SNES and nicely compact!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Lundgren

customer_reviews.title: Buy longer cables for the controllers. Extensions. The cables are way too short.
customer_reviews.text: I give this 4 stars instead of 5 because nintendo should have made the option to buy and download more ROMs. (They should have also produced enough consoles to meet demand). Nintendo, when you're hiring, let me know. We can take this places. There are options to hack the system yourself and add games, but I don't know how legal that is. Seems easy enough though. Also you know those cables need to be longer.. And put a reset button on the controller.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Authentic product will all the games listed! Got this as a graduation gift to myself and I love playing it with friends! Very nostalgic, just wish the cords were a lot longer. I have to sit pretty close to the tv to be able to play it. Overall, pretty great buy!
customer_reviews.author: M. S.

customer_reviews.title: Memories
customer_reviews.text: I grew up with the NES and SNES, and this took me back to my childhood. All my favorite games, played the same way. When I had the Wii, I bought a game or two from the SNES and it didn’t fee the same, but it does with this. My only complaint is it is small, fits in the palm of my hand, and the controllers don’t reach far. My TV is 65” and I can’t sit 3 feet away and play. Other than that, I love it
customer_reviews.author: Addy Daddy

customer_reviews.title: Same as it was 30 years ago
customer_reviews.text: I wish it had more games, say techmo bowl for example but other than that it's great. My 8 year old even enjoys it which is saying alot considering the graphics hes use to. I bought the cord extensions and I would recommend anybody to do the same but other than that it's the same as it was when you were a kid.
customer_reviews.author: Thatguy

customer_reviews.title: So fun!
customer_reviews.text: Only downfall is that on a big screen TV it shows somewhat fuzzy because they were originally designed to be played on smaller tv's so it can be hard to see at times. Otherwise it is very fun and comes with all the classic games.
customer_reviews.author: samanthalvee

customer_reviews.title: A must have for fans of the SNES
customer_reviews.text: Only flaw is that it is limited in the number of preloaded titles. However, they are good titles, and there is a good mix of genres represented here. I have had no problems with the unit or the controllers working as intended.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Get it while you can before these scalpers hike up the price even more
customer_reviews.text: SNES Classic is awesome. Controller and games all feel just like the original but I love having them built in. Two things would make it better. 1. I'd like to see Nintendo being able to include non-Nintendo licensed games like TMNT IV, Aladdin, MMPR, or some sports games. 2. I wish they'd have produced more from the start so I didn't have to buy it $30 more expensive than Nintendo's advertised price.
customer_reviews.author: Jackson from Arizona

customer_reviews.title: Cool, very cool.
customer_reviews.text: Payed double the price but at least it was a real Nintendo, not a knock off. Get the cord extenders and use a small tv. We found our 32" worked best after trying our 60". This thing is a lot of fun.
customer_reviews.author: James M. Hiner Jr.

customer_reviews.title: So much fun and great for younger kids
customer_reviews.text: So much fun to play! All my childhood memories came back when I hooked this up. Does take a bit of time to adjust to the old graphics now that we are accustomed to such realistic ones. Remote is so much simpler to use for younger kids than the Wii remote. Unit appears to be completely authentic and came packaged as such.
customer_reviews.author: vizzle23

customer_reviews.title: Finally the Super Nintendo of my childhood
customer_reviews.text: I freaking love this Super Nintendo! It has classic games ore downloaded like donkey Kong and Super Mario. My only complaint is the 5foot HDMI cable. My son and I couldn’t play the game comfortably we pretty much had to sit right in front of the TV. Save yourself the headache and purchase the 15 foot HDMI cable or wireless controllers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it
customer_reviews.text: Bought for Christmas present ... dad gets as much enjoyment out of this as the kids! Great selection of games & thank heavens for the save feature! No more starting from the beginning of each game every time you lose. Good value for the $, highly recommended! A+
customer_reviews.author: grahamgg

product_meta.title: Super NES Classic
product_meta.description: From your first ride on Yoshi to the final heart-pounding escape from Planet Zebes, the Super Nintendo Entertainment System is pure 16-bit retro gaming perfection. Now a new, miniaturized version is here, pre-loaded with 21 of the all-time greatest games, like Super Mario Kart and the first-ever release of Star Fox 2 Just plug it in and play. Live out the golden age of 16-bit gaming like never before. Choose games from the menu, create save points, and more. The system comes bundled with an HDMI cable, an USB charging cable, two Super NES Classic Controllers, and 21 games, pre-installed and ready-to-play. The system is also compatible with the Classic Controller and Classic Controller Pro accessories.
feature_bullets: The Super NES Classic Edition system has the original look and feel of the 90s home console, only smaller; Plus, this 1 comes fully loaded with 21 games
Get your hands on some of the best 2 player games of the era, including Super Mario Kart and Street Fighter II Turbo: Hyper Fighting
The Super NES Classic Edition is compatible with the Classic Controller and Classic Controller Pro accessories; Just plug it in and play
From your first ride on Yoshi to the final heart pounding escape from Planet Zebes, the Super Nintendo Entertainment System is pure 16 bit retro gaming perfection
My Game Play Demo:This new demo mode will replay your saved Suspend Points as part of the demo game footage instead of using built in demos

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars5,717 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
specifications.Pricing: The strikethrough price is the List Price. Savings represents a discount off the List Price.
